intro: Chisocheton trichocladus, commonly known as the hairy-leaved chisocheton, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
